turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: The building has been occupied and the locks have been changed.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: The University cannot do this. Is the room safe?

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Yes, I think so, it is still barred, but it is not the University who are in the building.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: So, who is in the building?

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: Have you lost all control of this city?

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: I don't understand it, there were a lot of people there last night, many Americans, I believe we should move carefully.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: I don't think you realise what will happen if those files are made public. The lives of thousands of officers depend on the secrecy of those records, including your own now.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: It was crazy not to have destroyed them

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: That was not my decision, I can only guess that one day we will again be active and our honour restored. In the meantime no one else must know those files exist. Secure the building and I will arrange alternative safe storage immediately.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: I don't care about Americans. Arrest them all if you have to, but keep those records secret.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: And there has been enquiries from the American Embassy maybe they are involved?

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: All the more reason to eliminate him.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: What if his accomplices have made copies?

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: It was all on a Russian format, I don't think that would be so easy; we must take that chance.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: Delay Mr Greenwell's departure until the disks have been located and you have notified me. Then, have one of your officers drive him home - I'll see to the rest.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: Subtitles) You have made many mistakes Pavel, let there be no more, for your sake.

turns.speaker: BELINDA
turns.text: That's one girl who can't take a hint.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Because she doesn't know what a hint is.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'll tell her you were here.

turns.speaker: BELINDA
turns.text: Pictures from the play. Jamie looks pretty --

turns.speaker: BELINDA
turns.text: No. You're with who you should be. It's like she chose you.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: And I have no idea why.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'm not hanging. I'm fixing my car --

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: You don't need a car you can't drive for a month. Go see Marvin.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Your father dropped off an extra check.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: It could help with a new car --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: -- I like the car I have.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I can't know things if you don't tell me.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: We talked. He wanted to get a bite -- after. I said no.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: After he moved out, I invited him to every practice, every game, every parent-teacher conference you ever had. He didn't show, not once.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: You going to let him? You going to reward him by being the son he was never man enough to be a father to?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: You look nice. I should have dressed.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: There's hot cider in the kitchen.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I haven't seen Clay or Eric lately.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: A late night or an early morning?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Honey, some of this is... farfetched. You take after me. People skills and common sense. Good dependable qualities.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I could take after Dad, too.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: You do. You're handsome and charming.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: That's eight years of school and training -- after college. And all that doesn't necessarily make you a better human being.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I could do it if I tried. Even Kelly thinks so.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: But if it doesn't happen, grab for something within reach. Life's tough enough without causing yourself disappointment --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Whatever my life is, I'm going to be friggin' sure I'm never disappointed --

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Have I told you how proud I am of you -- ?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Mom, great. But what I want is for me to be proud of me.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I told him to leave me alone.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: It was the only thing I've ever asked him!

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I have no idea what to say. How to act. What if I do the wrong thing?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Be yourself and I don't think there is a wrong thing.  Let Jamie take the lead. She'll let you know what she needs.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: He wants to talk to you.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Landon. You have two parents. We're both here for you even --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Everything's being done but it's not enough. I have to find something -- more.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Where is he? He's supposed to be here.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: No thinking. The doctor only gives you three seconds to decide --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: And you don't.  What's she doing in there?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: She's not. She's got her own ideas.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Belinda's telling everyone that kiss was real.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: And that you're scamming on Jamie Sullivan.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Landon Carter. I was driving the car that --

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: What kind of a man are you, son?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: No. Thanks. Gotta keep my wits for the drive home.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: He goes to my father's church. He could've died --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: -- This your idea of small talk?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Because, growing up, books were my world.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Your book and your brown sweater and your hair. What's more to know -- ?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: -- I wear the sweater because I'm cold. I read because no one talks to me. My hair is my hair. What is it exactly that's bothering you?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: You mean care what you say? I'm worrying about other things.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Like what? The moons of Jupiter?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Can't you have a normal conversation?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I don't want to have any conversation.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Good, cuz talking to you is like trying to explain red to a blind person.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: 'Believe in yourself and they will. Let me ask you, Lizzie. Look in the mirror? Are you pretty --?'

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You're like this fly, buzzing buzzing everywhere --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: -- This play means a lot to me.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: -- I know you don't suck at acting.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: -- Your act only works with an audience.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I know you don't want help.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Then we both know.  I'll point. You drive. Faster.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Because that's where the fire is?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Fire is like a living thing. Wild. Unpredictable.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: So you agree you need help?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: 28 is do something illegal. 42 is befriend an enemy.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: The reason I got the part... I'm a little like Lizzie. Except I don't worry about some man rescuing me.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You got some kind of list?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Are you asking to mock me or do you really want to know?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It's like a to-do list, but for my life.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: So what else is on this list?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Get very wasted. Lose your virginity --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Spend a year in the Peace Corps. Make a medical discovery --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I do know.  Be two places at once... learn to hit a baseball or turn a cartwheel... eat breakfast with chopsticks...

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: And you have to meet my father.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I'll get something for us to drink --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: He's a softy. Got him wrapped around my finger.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Because I try to be nice to people?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Cuz it's dark and quiet and you can see into another world.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Before Voyager we expected maybe a dozen rings --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: But there are thousands of them, made of floating ice --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Maybe debris from a moon that broke apart.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Or building blocks for a world that never formed.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Do you believe you'll see your mother again?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I hope so.  I think maybe she sees me now.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I'm building a larger one to see the nucleus of Haley's Comet --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: The dirty snowball at its core.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Yeah.  I'm probably not going to be around next time it comes.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: My relationship with God is my own.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: But you think about Him -- It -- Her.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Like in a church painting. I see this giant hovering over the ground. He's wearing a robe, and has long flowing hair, and he's pointing his finger at something.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Do you ever wonder why things happen the way they do?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I know there's a plan for everyone, but sometimes I don't understand what the message is -- or what the point is.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: There is no point. You live. You die. The end.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You have to believe to have faith.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: The Bible. Why should I read a bunch of dumb stories about some ancient guy who supposedly worked miracles.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Interpreted by another guy like my father.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Sometimes I don't even trust me.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: The play's going to be really good.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'm really glad you think so.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You're not in a very good mood.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: The play's in a couple of weeks.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Or anywhere where people might see us.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: So it's like you want to be secret friends.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: That's it! Exactly! You're reading my mind --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Then maybe you can read mine.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You were great the other night.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I haven't been nice to you.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: And that would ruin your reputation how?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Okay. Maybe some of that is true --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: You don't know the first thing about being someone's friend --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I don't want to be just your friend --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: You don't know what you want --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You don't either. Take a look at yourself. Maybe you're scared that someone might actually like you --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: And why would that scare me?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Because then you couldn't hide behind your books and your telescope and your sweater and your God.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Yeah, with a finish in about a decade.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: When I have something to say.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It means you can do anything.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I heard what you did. Thank you.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Why are you doing all this? To impress me?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Yes. But not as a date date.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I can't believe you asked my father's permission.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I wanted this to be a date.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I have to get you home by one.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: We're going somewhere. After. And no. I didn't ask your father.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Before we do this, I just want to say that a good life's gotta be about more than achieving stuff -- like on your list.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: It's about working with what you already have -- right now -- at your fingertips -- you know, spontaneously.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: The cells in our bodies are always changing. In six or seven years all your cells have changed. You could be like a completely new person from the inside out.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: That what's happening to you, only faster?
